p: Biopsy cases (n = 39) from gastrointestinal neuroendocrine tumors were collected from the year 2015 to 2017, from the archives of the Department of Pathology at Haukeland University Hospital, Bergen, Norway. The cases consisted of both endoscopic biopsies and resection specimens. To enable a thorough comparison of the performance of the image analysis tools, a broad variety of NETs in terms of location, stromal content and inflammation were chosen. All cases were reported to have a low Ki67 score of less than 5% (Table 1). The original diagnostic slides (Superfrost plus glass) were used, with the biopsy sections having been cut at a thickness of 5 microns (µm) and stained with Ki67 (Clone MIB-1, Dako, M7240) on the Roche Ventana Benchmark (Roche Diagnostics, Rotkreuz, Switzerland). The glass slides were scanned with a Hamamatsu Nanozoomer XR (Hamamatsu Photonics Norden AB, Kista, Sweden) at 40x magnification, resulting in a resolution of 0.23 μm per pixel. Digital slides were accessed through Aperio eSlide Manager 12 (W10-7018) and viewed in Aperio ImageScope (v12.4.0.7018, Aperio ImageScope, Leica Biosystems, IL, US). All materials were acquired, and all methods were carried out in accordance with relevant guidelines and regulations.
